programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos contemplates whether aliens that once visited Earth deliberately left a series of clues that mankind was eventually meant to decipher. Many ancient sites, and even recent ones like Roswell, all seem to be associated with reports of something coming down from the sky. Tsoukalos' research demonstrates that many of these places share a common symbol or shape-concentric circles. What is the significance of these designs, and is it possible they contain a coded message left by alien visitors?.

programme.desc: Sixty teams take on a very quick course down Windhaven Parkway in Fort Worth. Who will triumph in the Lone Star State?.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: An extraordinary Red Bull Soapbox course at the Yomiuriland Amusement Park in Tokyo. The course includes a unique see-saw feature and a wicked berm.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The posse meet three cat clerics who worship Lister. Lister vows to help them as they're being hunted by a feral cat leader who wants to wipe out cats who worship anyone but him. Ray Fearon joins the regular cast as the ruthless Rodon, leader of the feral cats, with Tom Bennett, Mandeep Dhillon and Lucy Pearman as the cat clerics.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy quiz show, in which he awards points for answers he finds most interesting. This edition sees Noel Fielding, Rhod Gilbert and Cariad Lloyd join regular panellist Alan Davies to tackle miscellaneous M-themed matters.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Rob Beckett, Jen Brister, Darren Harriott
programme.desc: Stand-up comedian Rob Beckett plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by rising comedy stars Jen Brister and Darren Harriott.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of guests Tom Allen, Ed Gamble, Milton Jones, Zoe Lyons and Geoff Norcott. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.desc: Lorraine Kelly and Dara O Briain join David Mitchell's team while Barry Cryer and Sue Perkins are captained by Lee Mack, on the panel game where contestants try to fool their opponents into mistaking fact for fiction and vice versa. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The crew stumbles upon the mysteriously abandoned SS Trojan, and while the group inspects the ship, Rimmer receives a distress call from his brother. Starring Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Searching for some tech to fix Starbug's faulty steering, Lister and his crew dock at a research station where scientists claim to have manufactured a 'cure' for evil. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Danny-John Jules and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: The Hurting

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie gets a taste of Cuba in Miami's fresh seafood, sets his sights at a shooting range, and heads cross-state to attempt a huge surf & turf challenge created just for him.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part special in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May take three used, V8-engined sports cars on a gruelling road trip covering 1,600 miles through Patagonia to the world's southernmost city. Having encountered stunning landscapes, mechanical mishaps and dreadful roads on their journey through Argentina, the trio's adventure is brought to a dramatic climax by a terrifying turn of events.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve Backshall leads a team into Yucatan, Mexico on the trail of the ancient Maya. Uncovering sinister secrets and artefacts, they push far into the underworld of the Maya.

programme.title: Hook (1991)
programme.desc: Peter Pan, who has finally grown up and is now a married lawyer with a family of his own, is whisked away by Tinkerbell to Neverland, where he must learn to fly again if he is to save his children from the clutches of Captain Hook. Steven Spielberg's fantasy adventure, with Robin Williams, Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines how the car industry in Germany and Japan blossomed following the Second World War, becoming manufacturing giants that far outstripped the Allied nations that had defeated them. He test drives some of the vehicles Germany and Japan produced during the post-war period, as well as an assortment of other classic cars, including E-Types and Mustangs. He also reveals the sad tale of the Austin Allegro, a vehicle that had a devastating impact on the British car industry.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James charts the history of 4x4 vehicles from the jeeps of the Second World war onwards, revealing how they rose in popularity in everyday use and in rallies. He explores the rivalry between Land Rover and Land Cruiser, and puts some classic vehicles through their paces by driving up Mount Fuji and through the Mojave desert.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James looks at some of the advances in motoring that never caught on, revealing how the petrol engine came to dominate in the 20th century, while concepts for jet engines and steam power fell by the wayside. He also drives an amphibious car and an electric scooter, and takes a ride in the world's fastest driverless car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team sets off on a high-altitude trek from Kathmandu, capital of Nepal, to the Forbidden City of Lo Manthang, a secretive kingdom perched high on the Tibetan plateau, on the far side of the Himalayas. On a five-day expedition through the highest mountains, deepest gorges and harshest terrain on the planet, Paddy McGuinness, Freddie Flintoff and Chris Harris battle huge river crossings, vast mudslides and dizzying mountain passes on a trip that would test even the hardiest new 4x4s to the limit. But Paddy, Freddie and Chris aren't crossing the Himalayas in new 4x4s. They're crossing the Himalayas in a small old Peugeot, a very compact old Renault, and Nepal's first (and only) home-built car.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Actor Mackenzie Crook, wildlife presenter Chris Packham, writer and broadcaster Victoria Coren Mitchell and comedian Rhod Gilbert join David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with odd personal statements that may or may not be true.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The team are arrested by the Mechanoid Intergalactic Liberation Front, while Kryten is given a new life of pampering and luxury. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Doc Martin star Martin Clunes hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz from June 2016, with comedian Jason Manford and Labour MP Jess Phillips joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines that week.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Exploring UFO sightings over Canada and the US during both World Wars and theories that Churchill knew about the attack on Pearl Harbor before it happened.

programme.title: Coast
programme.sub-title: Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
programme.desc: Neil Oliver leads the team to Cornwall and discovers the network of communication cables under Porthcurno beach. Miranda Krestovnikoff discovers how a shipwreck can be turned into a natural wildlife sanctuary, and Mark Horton visits the Isles of Scilly - known to some archaeologists as the Isles of the Dead.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The changing landscape of the coastline from Newcastle to Hull. Neil Oliver explores the ancient coastal home of the Venerable Bede, and goes to Bridlington to learn about the 200-year struggle to design an unsinkable lifeboat. Mark Horton discovers how laser technology could predict coastal erosion, Dick Strawbridge finds out how Middlesbrough's Transporter Bridge put the city on the map, and Miranda Krestovnikoff heads to Bempton Cliffs.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver meets historian Collum MacNeil on the deserted island of Mingulay, and discovers why it was abandoned in 1912 after 2,000 years of habitation. Miranda Krestovnikoff learns the truth behind the classic Ealing comedy Whisky Galore! on Eriskay, and chemist Mike Bullivant tries to recreate a 19th-century experiment to turn peaty soil into oil.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Part one of two. A re-examination of Jack the Ripper's crimes, revealing how the story known today was shaped by the sensationalist press of 1888. This documentary strips back decades of rumour and misinformation to reveal the true lives of the five women slain.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: Documentary explaining how a squadron of low-flying bombers freed resistance fighters from Amiens Jail during the Second World War.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Exploring UFO sightings over Canada and the US during both World Wars and theories that Churchill knew about the attack on Pearl Harbor before it happened.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ghostly house in a tropical paradise that is still feared by the locals and a pioneering complex marked by both glory and tragedy that will soon to be lost forever.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver meets historian Collum MacNeil on the deserted island of Mingulay, and discovers why it was abandoned in 1912 after 2,000 years of habitation. Miranda Krestovnikoff learns the truth behind the classic Ealing comedy Whisky Galore! on Eriskay, and chemist Mike Bullivant tries to recreate a 19th-century experiment to turn peaty soil into oil.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough continues his exploration of the continent in east Africa, which is a haven for life and supports a higher density of large mammals than anywhere else on Earth. From dense forests to snow-capped peaks, steamy swamps to endless savannah, it's also a land of unpredictable extremes, where creatures must adapt to survive. In Tanzania, a tiny lizard risks its life to eat flies from the face of a sleepy lion. The nesting habits of the 4ft shoebill are also captured on camera - the giant bird has two chicks, but due to sibling rivalry only one will survive. On the plains of Amboseli, a baby elephant is near to death in the drought, so its mother leaves the herd to stay with her offspring until the bitter end.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Tablelands Railways Line - Jungle Secrets
programme.desc: The Tablelands Railway Line in Queensland, Australia, which changed the face of one of the country's great states when it was constructed in the late 1800s.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: First hand accounts of America's opening air raid on the Japanese archipelago, led by Colonel Jimmy Doolittle.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Bizarre events during wartime, featuring a Nazi anti-gravity device, phantom cities built during the Second World War, Stalin's cursed tomb and poultry of mass destruction.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: A former dealer is selling his entire medal collection - will Dave and Steve find anything worth bidding for? And Steve digs deep into a WW1 army medic's family history.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason. Tight-fisted shopkeeper Arkwright purchases fire-damaged stock, only to find all the tins have lost their labels.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright attends a former customer's funeral, leaving Granville in charge of the store. However, the miserly shopkeeper has difficulty trusting his nephew to run it properly.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barrowclough uncover the stash in his and Godber's cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Bizarre events during wartime, featuring a Nazi anti-gravity device, phantom cities built during the Second World War, Stalin's cursed tomb and poultry of mass destruction.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver admires ginger seals at Walton-on-the-Naze, while Nick Crane examines the area's fossil record. Miranda Krestovnikoff explores research into the thornback ray on the Thames Estuary and how it aids conservation. The team also visits Felixstowe, the UK's busiest container port, where HM Revenue and Customs uncover a stash of cocaine smuggled among furniture.

programme.title: Deadliest Crash: Disaster at Le Mans
programme.desc: Documentary examining what caused Pierre Levegh's Mercedes to crash into the crowd during the 1955 Le Mans 24-hour race, killing more than 80 people - an accident that remains the worst in the history of motor racing. Among the theories discussed are the use of untested technologies by the car's manufacturers, the addition of a lethal fuel additive and allegations of reckless driving by future Formula One world champion Mike Hawthorn, who won the race with Jaguar team partner Ivor Bueb. Narrated by Jack Deam.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Part two of two. A re-examination of Jack the Ripper's crimes, revealing how the story known today was shaped by the sensationalist press of 1888. Featuring contributions from Ripper expert Donald Rumbelow and writer Hallie Rubenhold, author of The Five - the only book to tell the lives of the victims.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: First hand accounts of America's opening air raid on the Japanese archipelago, led by Colonel Jimmy Doolittle.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Bizarre events during wartime, featuring a Nazi anti-gravity device, phantom cities built during the Second World War, Stalin's cursed tomb and poultry of mass destruction.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The programme looks at a mysterious group of rusting ships stranded in an arid desert, and a monstrous defensive line on the snow-covered peaks of the Italian Alps.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the varied creatures of the Congo rainforest, one of the most competitive habitats on Earth. A sweet-toothed chimpanzee uses a complex array of tools to access honey from a beehive, the elusive picathartes bird feeds unsuspecting frogs to its dinosaur-like chicks and a massive female python reveals her maternal side as she sunbathes to incubate her eggs. Tiny leaf-folding frogs battle it out kung fu style, and as darkness falls the forest elephants gather to face their rivals.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species' great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: Stories of people who came close to losing their lives during the Second World War, beginning with tales about the Chindits, the army's elite jungle troops division who beat the Japanese in a daring mission.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Chinese authorities attempt a huge infrastructure project as they try to move vast amounts of water from the wet south of the country to the dry north.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: The story of Zofia Potocka, the lover of Russian military leader Grigory Potemkin, who ran a successful spy network in the Russo-Turkish War of 1787-92.

programme.title: Samurai Warrior Queens
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary telling the story of Nakano Takeko, a female samurai who defied convention to lead a rebellion against Japan's western-influenced Emperor in 1868.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. The first edition examines how the sun affects life on Earth through the seasons, following a polar bear preparing its cubs for a long journey to avoid becoming stranded on floating glaciers. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the world's caves, including the Lechuguilla Cave in America, which contains chambers filled with 6m-long crystals. He observes creatures in Texas and Thailand that never see daylight, and inside Deer Cave in Borneo he finds five million bats whose droppings support an entire ecosystem.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The nature series looks at animals that live on some of the world's highest mountains. Cameras show gelada baboons screaming to frighten off predators in Ethiopia, demoiselle cranes struggling to migrate over the Himalayas, snow leopards hunting on the peaks of Pakistan and a wild giant panda nursing a baby in a hillside cave. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough focuses on animals living in deserts. Cameras explore the dry Atacama of Chile, where guanacos survive by licking dew off cacti, and capture the rare sight of wild camels eating snow to stay hydrated on Mongolia's Gobi plains. In the rocky Namibian desert, elephants desperately search for food and lions wander the wilderness hunting oryx.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Camera crews follow the activities of wildlife in the Arctic and Antarctic, including an emperor penguin colony's nine-month migration across sea ice to its breeding ground. The team also takes aerial and underwater shots to capture humpback whales feeding and tracks a male polar bear as it swims 100km to find new ice from which to hunt seals.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the documentary exploring Earth's natural history and the factors that have affected it. programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A secretive underground base that concealed the power to destroy nations, and a sprawling industrial relic clinging to the edge of an unforgiving waterfall.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: At St Athan in Wales, engineer John Sparks and his team of ex-Navy and RAF engineers begin the task of reassembling the Czech-built jet from nine parts delivered by lorry.

programme.title: Churchill's Secret Son
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of Tipperary-born businessman and Conservative cabinet minister Brendan Bracken, who became Winston Churchill's right-hand man during the Second World War by opposing efforts to appease Adolf Hitler. The film considers the possibility of a biological connection between the two men.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A seemingly endless concrete line stretching through the French countryside, which sits as a monument to a discarded engineering advancement.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A towering structure with an explosive past, a deserted cityscape, a mysterious top-secret facility and a vast Nazi construction.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Shanghai Tower, which at a height of 632 metres is the second tallest building in the world, With a weight of 850,000 tons, it has been built to withstand winds of typhoon proportions.

programme.title: Graham Hill: Driven
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of motor racing star Graham Hill, who became the only man to win the Formula One World Championship, Indianapolis 500 and Le Mans 24-hour race - but whose reckless streak was to prove his undoing. Among those sharing their memories of the charismatic Englishman are his son Damon - who became Formula One world champion himself in 1996 - and Jackie Stewart.

programme.title: Jim Clark: The Quiet Champion
programme.desc: Profile of the two-time Formula One champion, who was killed at the height of his career. Featuring rare archive footage from family home-movies, candid interviews with the driver himself and comments by close friends, including Jackie Stewart, who reminisces about their time spent together racing when they were known as Batman and Robin.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The role played by engineering giant Vickers during the Second World War, including the development of the Spitfire and how the Royal Navy recovered from losing so many warships.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species' great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An exploration of the survival techniques used by creatures inhabiting the deep oceans of the world, where adaptation is paramount for those dwelling on the surface as well as below. Pods of dolphins are filmed charging in search of prey, surprising methods for conserving energy are revealed as deep-sea octopuses 'fly' with wings, and vampire squid use bioluminescence to create a colourful display.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.

Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Status Quo play Pictures of Matchstick Men on Top of the Pops in 1968, the Who perform Long Live Rock in the Old Grey Whistle Test studio, Dire Straits deliver Tunnel of Love and Lynyrd Skynyrd bring a taste of the American South with Sweet Home Alabama. The programme also features rare performances from George Benson, Leo Kottke, Link Wray and Tom Petty.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Including electric performances by the Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, David Bowie, Motorhead, Nazareth, AC/DC and George Thorogood, as well as acoustic material by Michael Chapman, Horslips and Paco de Lucia.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Broadcaster Chris Tarrant continues his travels along the world's most challenging railways. Here he attempts to cross the Andes, setting off from the coast of Chile and heading for the Bolivian capital of Sucre. Along the way he traverses some of the driest and most inhospitable environments on the planet, hitches rides on unusual trains and deals with altitude sickness at more than 3,000 metres.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Chris Tarrant on the Polar Express
programme.desc: Chris sets out to reach the northernmost railway station on Earth, inside Russia's Arctic Circle. This is an epic 2,000-mile adventure from Moscow into Arctic Siberia, and begins with a marathon 19-hour leg. Along the way he enjoys a reindeer stew with a local family and takes the controls of one of the massive locomotives that power the trains, before pressing on along railways built under the brutal regime of Joseph Stalin.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Chinese authorities attempt a huge infrastructure project as they try to move vast amounts of water from the wet south of the country to the dry north.

programme.title: Jim Clark: The Quiet Champion
programme.desc: Profile of the two-time Formula One champion, who was killed at the height of his career. Featuring rare archive footage from family home-movies, candid interviews with the driver himself and comments by close friends, including Jackie Stewart, who reminisces about their time spent together racing when they were known as Batman and Robin.

programme.title: Graham Hill: Driven
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of motor racing star Graham Hill, who became the only man to win the Formula One World Championship, Indianapolis 500 and Le Mans 24-hour race - but whose reckless streak was to prove his undoing. Among those sharing their memories of the charismatic Englishman are his son Damon - who became Formula One world champion himself in 1996 - and Jackie Stewart.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian follows in the footsteps of 19th-century gold prospectors, attempting to find riches in a remote region on the edge of the Canadian arctic. He is joined on his expedition by polar explorer Felicity Aston and physiologist Dr Kevin Fong. The first challenge of the trek is to cross Alaska's Coast Mountains, where they retrace two routes set by 19th-century miners and brave icy rivers, avalanche-prone slopes and near vertical ascents.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: The documentary uncovering the hidden history of Britain continues with the story of the department store Selfridges, looking at the ways it changed the country's shopping habits. Plus, an examination of the life of Mr Selfridge himself.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: British troops save Edith and Rene from execution, and the pair are released into the woods. Meanwhile, the Germans decide to head for Spain, and Michelle joins Crabtree in a duet. Classic wartime sitcom, starring Gorden Kaye and Carmen Silvera.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The Colonel and Gruber's escape plan has gone awry, so they try to make general Von Klinkerhoffen believe the Resistance had kidnapped them.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene is imprisoned by communist leader Louise, who plans to use him as her love slave, while Mimi, Edith and Yvette are convinced he is dead and decide to hold a seance.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that 'goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications'.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: A former dealer is selling his entire medal collection - will Dave and Steve find anything worth bidding for? And Steve digs deep into a WW1 army medic's family history.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: At St Athan in Wales, engineer John Sparks and his team of ex-Navy and RAF engineers begin the task of reassembling the Czech-built jet from nine parts delivered by lorry.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King
programme.desc: Secret History documentary telling the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. It was felt that Philip was rough and ill-mannered - and with the Second World War still fresh in most people's minds, the royal and political elite disliked his German roots. But following the death of King George VI in 1952, the establishment feared a dynastic coup, with the Queen torn between the two sides. The documentary examines the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's â€˜Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the world's mountain ranges. A female snow leopard with a cub ends up caught between two rival males, grizzly bears rub themselves up against trees in an attempt to shed their winter fur, and golden eagles hunt over snow-capped peaks.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live in the desert, including a pride of desert lions that risks hunting a giraffe several times their size. The film also features an immense swarm of locusts, sand grouse flying for 120 miles to gather water for their offspring, and an unprecedented recording of a tiny bat defending itself against one of the world's deadliest scorpions.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Wildlife that inhabit the world's grasslands, areas that are struck by some of the most dramatic seasonal changes seen in the world. The programme features footage of Brazil's giant anteaters and Asian saiga antelope, as well as lions engaging in ferocious battles with buffalo in the flooded Okavango, bee-eaters taking advantage of elephants to help them catch insects, and caribou embarking on migrations across the freezing northern tundra, stalked every step of the way by predatory Arctic wolves.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wild animals that have made a home in cities, including leopards on the streets of Mumbai, peregrine falcons hunting among New York's skyscrapers, hyenas that live peacefully alongside the people of Harar, macaques in Jaipur, and langurs in Jodhpur, which are regarded as having great religious significance by the citizens. The programme also examines how some animals are struggling to survive in urban environments, and questions how cities can be built to serve their needs as well as those of the human inhabitants.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that 'goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications'.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Mathewsons agree to sell a vintage threshing machine and large collection of tractors, but extracting them from old barns on a Yorkshire farm proves a bigger job than anticipated.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's washing-machine breaks down, and Arkwright decides to try and lure her into his home with the offer of his vintage machine.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville struggles to find some privacy when the milkwoman makes a pass at him. Nurse Gladys Emmanuel steps in by persuading Arkwright to take her to a hotel.

programme.title: Jackie Stewart the Flying Scot
programme.desc: Profile of the legendary racing driver, tracing his early career and influence on Formula One.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Henri Landru, who targeted lonely and vulnerable women during the First World War. He seduced them with promises of marriage and lured them to houses outside Paris where the women vanished. With the police uninterested in investigating the disappearances, two women took it upon themselves to pursue Landru.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The bravery of the 333rd Field Artillery Battalion, a depleted unit of African-American soldiers who risked everything to fight off the Nazis at Bastogne, Belgium.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Concrete channels hidden in a mountaintop forest, a collapsing bridge, a marooned military base and the upright rusting carcass of ship.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how fleas are able to jump great distances for their size and attempts to discover how fast a cheetah can run.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores animals that have developed tool-making skills to help them survive, including orangutans and crows.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the wildlife eking out an existence in and around the scorching wilderness of the Sahara, where only the toughest survive. It's a constant struggle against dehydration, as zebra battle over dwindling rivers, camels search for water and tiny barn swallows navigate thousands of square miles of barren sand to find a life-saving oasis. The naked mole rat avoids the heat by living a subterranean existence, while the silver ant is able to take on the midday sun - but needs a 'spacesuit' to do it.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Shanghai Tower, which at a height of 632 metres is the second tallest building in the world, With a weight of 850,000 tons, it has been built to withstand winds of typhoon proportions.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of Major General Robert Laycock who rallied his ill-equipped troops to see off a German attack on Crete, Greece.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Forgotten relics from the defence of America's homeland, concealed by the banks of the Mississippi, and a concrete behemoth on the French coast that proved invulnerable to attacks.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: The team acquire a personalised Victorian pistol and try to track down the original owner. A customer brings in brasses that his dad brought back from the Somme.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.desc: Honey is interviewed by Adam and fights to save her career, insisting she was abducted by new husband Scott. programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The propane cylinder storage depot blaze continues, leaving Jaffa badly burned and plunging George into agonies of guilt. programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane returns to work but she and Jac take an instant dislike to one another - and Ric does not help matters by suggesting they both apply for the consultant's job. Mickie is not impressed when new nurse Kyla takes an extended break, but softens once she learns the reason. Mark's animosity toward Ben's mother softens, but Lola still thinks he is getting too involved in the case - especially as the boy's chances of survival ebb away.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Adam reveals he is HIV-positive, placing Charlie in the unenviable position of deciding what action _ if any _ he should take. Sunny proves to be something of a loose cannon, allowing his temper to get the better of him, and an accident prompts a grandmother to accept a few home truths. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson and Ian Bleasdale.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of three. Yvonne is suspended from duty pending further investigation into the death of young thug Lee Thomas, and Leela is also accused of assaulting a suspect, leaving the relief uncertain as to what constitutes reasonable force when making an arrest. Fearful of leaving himself open to accusations of heavy-handedness or police brutality, Tony later hesitates to use force in a confrontation with local youths - and suffers a horrific beating. Meanwhile Zain Nadir agrees to do a stint in CID before beginning his next undercover job.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Danny begs Pauline to run away with him. Husband Greg begs Christine to have him back - where does this leave Arthur? Grant tells Sharon he's met someone.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant explores a romantic interest under the watchful and jealous eyes of Sharon and Michelle warns Shelley against pursuing a relationship with Mark.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Jaffa is seriously injured when the Blue Watch team attends a nightmarish scenario of burning cars and houses, while Nick mounts a desperate search for Ariadne.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie decides to turn Jamie's room into a nursery, while Lexie becomes convinced there is a ghost in the house after she sees a mysterious figure at the window. Duncan is prompted to take control of his relationship with Irene when she talks about leaving Glenbogle, and Molly is less than impressed with the new neighbour.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Karen tentatively looks forward to seeing her mother for the first time in 25 years, but unfortunately the reunion doesn't turn out as she hoped. Relations are hardly any more harmonious elsewhere, as Oscar continues to give Cheryl the cold shoulder _ leading to a devastating accident at home. Popular drama, starring Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Joey goes to inform Martina that the family will be holidaying in Rome for the Christmas period.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Clive's relatives descend on the camp in an effort to stop his marriage to Gladys - which could give the groom-to-be the excuse he has been looking for. Classic comedy, starring David Griffin, Paul Shane and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean take care of Stephen while Penny goes into hospital for a routine operation - but their task is complicated by a case of mistaken identity. Geoffrey Palmer, Judi Dench and Moira Brooker star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg persuades Compo and Blamire to buy a car so they can get around more easily, but the old banger they end up with turns out to be more trouble than it is worth.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: An elderly man is killed in his dilapidated mansion, prompting Gently and Bacchus to delve into the building's past as a children's home. They soon have their prime suspect - a man who once lived there - but it becomes clear that some of the locals, including property developer Cora Davidson, have something to hide. Feature-length drama, guest starring Matthew McNulty and Jill Halfpenny, with Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: When a retrospective exhibition of murdered fashion designer Ritchie Levene's work opens, the team is prompted to re-examine the three-year-old crime. The detectives learn about his tempestuous relationships with his new spouse, personal assistant and ex-wife Sarah, who believes his brother Adrian is the killer because he had the most to gain from his death. Meanwhile, Gerry enlists Emily to help update his image, although not everyone is impressed with the results. Crime drama, guest starring Rupert Graves and Hannah Waterman.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Boyd receives a Nazi ceremonial dagger in an anonymous package in the post. The weapon prompts him to reopen the unsolved murder file of a girl whose body was found on the street in May 1945 - a case last examined by his former colleague Mel Silver shortly before her death. Feature-length crime drama, starring Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of three. Yvonne is suspended from duty pending further investigation into the death of young thug Lee Thomas, and Leela is also accused of assaulting a suspect, leaving the relief uncertain as to what constitutes reasonable force when making an arrest. Fearful of leaving himself open to accusations of heavy-handedness or police brutality, Tony later hesitates to use force in a confrontation with local youths - and suffers a horrific beating. Meanwhile Zain Nadir agrees to do a stint in CID before beginning his next undercover job.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Jaffa is seriously injured when the Blue Watch team attends a nightmarish scenario of burning cars and houses, while Nick mounts a desperate search for Ariadne.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Personal problems are high on the troops' agenda as Andy Butcher's mother throws his love life into disarray, Angela McCleod's house is broken into and Sergeant-Major Alan Fitzpatrick learns he cannot treat his daughter like a private on parade.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The troops pull out all the stops to save Colonel Drysdale from terrorists stalking him at a racing event, but he seems oblivious to danger. Meanwhile, Andy tries to worm his way back into the CO's good books and Jacko unwittingly antagonises Julie by trying to find out whether she is seeing Tony behind his back.

programme.title: The Bill

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Sam performs a risky operation that he has never done before - to Connie's outrage. Elliot gets a new PA but finds she cramps his style, while Chrissie receives a variety of Valentine's gifts from a secret admirer. Paul Nicholas guest stars as a patient whose vasectomy reversal goes horribly wrong.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Duffy's discovery that Adam is HIV-positive threatens the possibility of his return to nursing, and Sunny and Tina visit Sam at his beach retreat in Cornwall - can they persuade him to return to Holby A&E? Starring Jonathan Kerrigan, Cathy Shipton and Vince Pellegrino.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of three. As Tony recovers in hospital, Gabriel and Roger are disciplined for using their CS spray in a tense situation, prompting June to stand up for coppers' rights and call the demoralised relief out on strike. Unfortunately for Lance, he's already been dragged out on an unauthorised mission by Zain Nadir, and ends up being held at gunpoint by a local gangster. On the personal front, Phil receives the shocking news that Kate Maltby has been rushed to hospital and might lose their baby, while Dan receives a letter in the internal mail from someone who clearly knows about his affair with Sun Hill newcomer Rochelle Barratt.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nigel, fed up with being single, doffs his cap at the elusive Debbie; Ian, struggling to comply with the demands of health and safety is strapped for cash.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The unexpected closure of the 'Meal Machine' is the hot topic on the square. Michelle has concerns over Mark's relationship with Shelley.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team is called to the scene of a horrendous car crash, Pearce is forced to relive a fatal incident when he attends the resulting inquest and Nick is puzzled by a message from Ariadne.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: A mysterious traveller arrives in Glenbogle with some questions about his past, leading to a secret being unearthed. Meanwhile, Lexie resolves to prove herself by making the Ghillies' Ball a success, but when her plans for a traditional Highland celebration are scuppered she decides to organise an event in her own unique style.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A pregnant schoolgirl runs away after confiding in Anna, deciding to have her baby by herself on the moors, and David tires of pandering to Karen, suspecting her mother is the real reason behind the mystery illness. Chris refuses to give up on his relationship with Beth, despite her plans to finish their affair, and Vic becomes riled by Lucy's girlie chats with Jess, finding it hard to accept that his daughter is growing up. Drama, starring Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Joey's past returns to haunt him. Billy finds himself in trouble with the law and Freddie is notable by his absence.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The staff treat April to a trip to the cinema - but a mix-up with the projectionist spells disaster for the outing, as an old war film is shown instead of the intended movie. Classic comedy, starring Paul Shane, David Griffin and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy worries she has a stalker when she spots someone following her home at night. Lionel's efforts to calm the situation are unsuccessful, so Alistair steps in to help and manages to uncover the mysterious man's identity.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Inspired by a local art event, Blamire, Compo and Clegg decide to go camping and take some creative photographs of anything that interests them. Michael Bates, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Lynley and Havers investigate a case at Smithfield Market when a frozen body is found on a meat truck. The victim is carrying a page of parchment written in Arabic and a counterfeit British passport. A number of suspects emerge, including a dealer in antiquities, a forger, and a surgeon who may have been selling human organs. With Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Mark Benton.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When a woman defends her daughter from a mugger, she sets in motion a chain of events that places herself and her children in mortal danger, as her DNA is linked to an old murder case. Meanwhile, Boyd hears news of his son, who has been missing for seven years. Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens the case of criminal Mark Johnson, who was killed in a fire at London's Union club in 1996. The original investigation was hampered by silence among witnesses and associates, but with new information suggesting the blaze was a targeted arson attack, the detectives hope they will have more success. Drama, guest starring Roy Marsden, Martin Marquez and Tom Watt.

programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Barton House in the Cotswolds, where the garden is usually devoid of flowers.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Mark gets the thumbs-up in his psychiatric report and rejoins the Fusiliers, determined to make a fresh start. Unfortunately, CSM Fitzpatrick isn't convinced he is up to the job and resolves to make life difficult for him, with disastrous consequences for Tony and Jacko.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jessica Bailey finds it a struggle to fit in amongst the regiment, and an officer makes Chris McLeod jealous after he returns from leave.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of three. programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Lola's daughter comes to the hospital with her boyfriend, who has reacted badly to a tetanus injection. However, the news that they are planning to go travelling together does not go down well. Sam advises a patient to fake her symptoms to increase her chances of getting into surgery, with disastrous consequences. Michael French rejoins the cast as consultant Nick Jordan.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Eve's friend Gerry is rushed into A&E, forcing her to make a drastic decision, while Holly's attempts to reunite an estranged family meet unexpected complications. Hospital drama, starring Ian Bleasdale, Cathy Shipton and Barbara Marten.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part three of three. Adam tries to defuse the threat of strike action by the relief, reminding them of their duties as police officers and offering to let Yvonne return to the station while the inquiry takes its course. Dan reacts with dismay when Rochelle suggests they put their affair on hold, Gary chafes under Suzie's condescending attitude, and Samantha looks on in disbelief as the simmering hostility between brothers Phil and Steve erupts into violence.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur has an unexpected visitor. Phil discovers a new drinking partner. Frank gets a hot tip and Hattie is forced to accept Ian's plans for the future.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nigel has a dream date. Frank is out of his depth. Greg Hewitt has news for Arthur and Christine.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: What's Santa Brought for Nora Then?
programme.desc: Christmas special from 1989. Compo has difficulty thinking of what to get Nora for Christmas, so decides to consult Auntie Wainwright for advice. Bill Owen stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A man is murdered at the unveiling of a new church clock and the cleric must act quickly before an innocent woman is sent to the gallows. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest becomes involved with a theatrical family when he discovers that a drowning initially thought to be a tragic accident was actually a murder. Drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack, Josephine Butler and Julian Wadham.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: After a man is found hanging in the conservatory following a poetry recital, the priest soon realises he could not have committed suicide, and the search for a murderer begins. Drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: A movie crew from Hollywood arrives in the village to make a film, and pesky pensioners Compo, Clegg and Foggy manage to get themselves roped in as extras. Norman Wisdom guest stars, with Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The residents are troubled by a bicycle, and Compo's lucky rabbit's foot causes even more problems, while Sid tries his best to avoid Ivy. Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Michael Bates star in the long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: Two sisters are found gassed in their home - one a talented author, the other with a terrible secret - and when only one survives, foul play is suspected.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Lady Felicia is horrified to find an injured man stuck in a tree on her estate, apparently thrown there from a passing train on an overhead viaduct. When Sid is implicated as the guilty party, Father Brown is left to clear his name - but only if he is truly innocent. Mystery drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The Church of Apollo comes to Kembleford and Susie is immediately drawn to Kalon, its charismatic leader. After his wife is murdered, Father Brown must break his spell over Susie or risk losing her for ever. Drama, starring Kasia Koleczek, Michael Maloney and Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The clergyman is called in to investigate when two nuns die in unusual circumstances at St Agnes convent. However, the mystery attracts the attention of Sister Boniface, a would-be sleuth with a passion for detective novels. Crime drama remake, guest starring comedienne Lorna Watson.

programme.title: Lady Chatterley
programme.desc: First episode of Ken Russell's four-part adaptation of DH Lawrence's controversial novel. An aristocratic woman trapped in a sexless marriage embarks on a passionate affair with a gamekeeper. Joely Richardson and Sean Bean star.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Family secrets are revealed when Dr Finlay's mother comes to stay at Arden House. Dr Jennifer Napier, now using her own name, treats Annie Kirk who is suffering from a heart condition. Rural medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Napier becomes concerned at the generally poor state of women's health in Tannochbrae, and launches a bold new campaign to set matters right. Rhona falls head over heels in love, and two surprising would-be instructors step forward to teach the locals ballroom dancing. Highland medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. The roguish antiques dealer finds a Scottish gothic temple brings him closer to Lady Jane, while love is in the air for Eric. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Lady Felicia is horrified to find an injured man stuck in a tree on her estate, apparently thrown there from a passing train on an overhead viaduct. When Sid is implicated as the guilty party, Father Brown is left to clear his name - but only if he is truly innocent. Mystery drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The clergyman is called in to investigate when two nuns die in unusual circumstances at St Agnes convent. However, the mystery attracts the attention of Sister Boniface, a would-be sleuth with a passion for detective novels. Crime drama remake, guest starring comedienne Lorna Watson.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest joins in the search for a girl who is believed to be radioactive, and tries to find out who is responsible for her overnight disappearance. Drama, starring Kasia Koleczek and Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates a murder at the Kembleford charity treasure hunt. General suspicion falls on a bereaved man who wants revenge, but Father Brown is determined to prove he is innocent. Mystery, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The mayor is electrocuted while speaking at the Kembleford village fete, and Father Brown suspects he was the victim of a deliberate act. Meanwhile, Mrs McCarthy's past comes back to haunt her. Mystery, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest's priceless Blue Cross is targeted by infamous criminal Flambeau, so taking matters into his own hands Father Brown sets out to try to save the thief's soul, but risks falling into a trap. Mystery, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Crime drama about a British detective working on a Caribbean island. When the owner of a sugar plantation is discovered dead with a machete in his back, DI Poole and his team have a seemingly impossible case to solve. There are numerous suspects, including the victim's alcoholic ex-wife and much younger widow, but they all have seemingly cast-iron alibis - and many were with one another when the murder took place. Crime drama, starring Ben Miller, with guest appearances by Stephanie Beacham (Dynasty, Tenko), James Cosmo (Game of Thrones) and Tom Ward (Silent Witness).

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A young nun is found dead in a smoke-filled bedroom in what seems like a terrible accident caused by a lit cigarette. But when Richard deduces it must have been murder, there are no shortage of suspects, including other nuns, a priest and the mother superior - as well as an unscrupulous PR man promoting a holy spring in the convent grounds. The question is, with the room locked from the inside, how could anyone have committed the crime in the first place? Kenneth Cranham, Patrick Baladi and Caroline Langrishe guest star.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch reunites with inventor Nikola Tesla to help with the murder investigation of a man experimenting on a devise that would make him invisible.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A body is discovered floating in the pool of an exclusive cosmetic surgery clinic and several things point to suicide - the victim was going through a messy divorce and there is an empty pill box in her room. But DI Poole has several reasons to believe Valerie Dupree was murdered - not least the fact she poured herself a cup of the world's most expensive tea but only drank half. The pressure is on to find the culprit as the clinic is highly respected on the island and the chief surgeon is an old friend of Commissioner Patterson - and as the detectives begin to dig, they discover many sordid secrets among the guests and staff. Cherie Lunghi (Secret Diary of a Call Girl), James Fleet (The Vicar of Dibley) and Emma Pierson (Hotel Babylon) guest star.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Treasure hunters arrive on the island to track down the loot of a legendary pirate, a search that comes to an abrupt halt when the party's geologist is shot dead in leader Daniel Morgan's tent. As the murder weapon was a 300-year-old pistol, DI Poole decides every member of the team is a suspect - but the investigation takes a strange turn when Daniel falls victim to a series of unfortunate and coincidental accidents. Has a mythical pirate's curse become a reality or is someone from the 21st century simply trying to bump him off? Ben Miller and Sara Martins star, with Michael Brandon (Dempsey and Makepeace) and Kelly Adams (Hustle).

programme.title: Lady Chatterley
programme.desc: Sir Clifford employs a nurse to look after him, leaving his wife with more time to devote to her clandestine relationship with Mellors. However, the passion of the affair is beginning to wane. Starring Joely Richardson and Sean Bean.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Lynda La Plante's crime drama. DI Pat North investigates the case of a woman abducted in broad daylight, but a sudden murder confession leaves the squad with more questions than answers. Meanwhile, DCS Michael Walker begins to fear for his children's safety at the hands of his ex-wife's new boyfriend. Kate Buffery and David Hayman star.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. The roguish antiques dealer finds a Scottish gothic temple brings him closer to Lady Jane, while love is in the air for Eric. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: DI Morell investigates Honey's apparent abduction by new husband Scott, little suspecting she has fled with him of her own volition and is preparing to set sail for France. Unfortunately, he blurts out a confession of his guilt as they're waiting for the boat to arrive, leaving her facing the uncomfortable realisation that she's trapped with a murderer. Back at Sun Hill, Yvonne leaves herself open to charges of using excessive force to detain a suspect and Amber teases Dan Casper about his alleged run-in with a gang of armed youths.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Honey is interviewed by Adam and fights to save her career, insisting she was abducted by new husband Scott. JT begins to suspect Gina has cancer, and Dan alleges Amber has been blackmailing him to do menial duties on her behalf, while Yvonne is devastated to learn Lee Thomas, the young thug she forcibly restrained at the cemetery, has died of his injuries.
